PictureMultiSelect.Question: Which of the pictures below were trade items were desired by British merchants in Asia?
PictureMultiSelect.policy: Score points when all answers are correct.

DragWordsInSentence.Question: What was the significance of the events in 1839-42? Drag and drop words into the sentence to explain.
DragWordsInSentence.Sentence: The <<Opium War >> took place between 1839 and 1842. <<Great Britain >> was victorious. This lead to the continued opening of <<Chinese ports>> and an increase in the economic influence of industrialized <<European powers >>.
DragWordsInSentence.distractors: Latin America Invasion of Normandy France
DragWordsInSentence.policy: Score points for each wrong word which is corrected, deduct points for each correct word which was changed . Minimum score 0.

TextMultpleChoice.Question: Using the information in the story, what is the most likely reason that a man such as Fei Hong became involved on the Opium trade?
TextMultpleChoice.Answers: The opium trade was one of the only ways for an average person to provide a higher class lifestyle for their family. Fei Hong had no skills to have a profession Fei Hong was an evil man He did not know opium was in the containers

TextMultpleChoice.Question:
Read the following excerpt from the Treaty of Nanjing:

There shall henceforth be Peace and Friendship between … (England and China) and between their respective Subjects, who shall enjoy full security and protection for their persons and property within the Dominions of the other.

Article II His Majesty the Emperor of China agrees that British Subjects, with their families and establishments, shall be allowed to reside, for the purpose of carrying on their commercial pursuits, without restraint at the Cities and Towns of Canton, Amoy, Foochow- fu, Ningpo, and Shanghai….

…... in future at all Ports where British Merchants may reside, and to permit them to carry on their mercantile transactions with whatever persons they please,

It being obviously necessary and desirable, that British Subjects should have some Port whereat they may careen and refit their Ships, when required, and keep Stores for that purpose, His Majesty the Emperor of China cedes to Her Majesty the Queen of Great Britain, etc., the Island of Hong-Kong, to be possessed in perpetuity by her Britannic Majesty, Her Heirs and Successors, and to be governed by such Laws and Regulations as Her Majesty the Queen of Great Britain, etc., shall see fit to direct.”

What is the main purpose of the treaty?
TextMultpleChoice.Answers: to give Britain control of Hong Kong and free trade in China to protect Hong Kong from foreign invaders to stop the flow of opium into China to force British citizens out of China

PictureMultpleChoice.Question: Which political cartoon indicates the European industrialized states practicing economic imperialism?

TextMultpleChoice.Question: What was the main pattern in world history from 1750 to 1900?
TextMultpleChoice.Answers: European nations and the United States rapidly industrialized and practiced economic imperialism Latin America rose to become a dominate economic power Only nations, not private companies, engaged in trade Asian nations overtook Europe in economic influence It was difficult to get raw materials because trade was blocked around most of the world

TextMultpleChoice.Question: As the narrative ends, Fei Hong heard the roar of cannonballs. Based on the story and your knowledge of the time period, what was happening?
TextMultpleChoice.Answers: The British were bombarding China in order to force the opening of the ports to British trade. Fei Hong was being arrested by the British soldiers for opium use The British and French were fighting a battle against each other The opium in the ships was flammable and ignited

DragWordsInSentence.Question: A pattern of economic imperialism developed across the globe. The desire for different commodities helped drive this pattern and build European economic dominance. Drag and drop the trade goods into each example.
DragWordsInSentence.Sentence: <<Cotton>> grown in India was used to make textiles in Britain. <<Opium>> was produced in the Middle East, then sold by British merchants in China. <<Palm Oil>> was made in Africa and then used throughout Europe. << Copper>> was mined in Chile and used for European products.
DragWordsInSentence.policy: Score points for each wrong word which is corrected, deduct points for each correct word which was changed . Minimum score 0.

TextMultpleChoice.Question: Which historical event is most similar to the Opium Wars?
TextMultpleChoice.Answers: The British construction of the port of Buenos Ares in Argentina The conflict between India and Pakistan The development of the Silk Road The Crimean War

TextMultpleChoice.Question: With hindsight, what would Fei Hong think about this story? Make an inference from the narrative.
TextMultpleChoice.Answers: Fei Hong ruined his family's life by getting involved with opium. Being an opium trafficker was good even though it was illegal. Woodworking was much worse for one's health than opium. China benefited greatly from British trade.
